content: The "Trash Reduction Act of 2015" imposes a tax on carryout bags under a new subchapter in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. A Carryout Bag Trust Fund is created in the Treasury for this purpose, with appropriations from section 4056. Funds can be used for payments under section 6433 and transferred to the Land and Water Conservation Fund. The Land and Water Conservation Fund Act of 1965 provides funds equivalent to transactions taxed under section 4056. Amounts transferred to the Fund are not considered for appropriations. A study on reducing carryout bag use and promoting recycling is required by December 31, 2017. The Comptroller General is required to conduct a study on reducing carryout bag use and promoting recycling. The report will address measures to increase effectiveness, including the tax amount on each bag, and the impact on US businesses. The report will be submitted to the House Committee on Ways and Means and the Senate Committee on Finance. The amendments to the code include the addition of new sections for a qualified plastic carryout bag recycling program and a carryout bag trust fund, effective July 1, 2016.
